result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Savon Q Morris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Court passes case so that Defendant can call the Public Defender's office to be evaluated. 
10:39 AM Defendant qualifies for representation by Public Defender.
Case is set for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned plea hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Savon Q Morris
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2022)
Prior: 2102 W Orchard St Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Not to possess any burglarious tools including reciprocating saw. Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:56 PM Defendant Savon Q Morris in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
